p: We used the Bd isolate Paluma-Lseratta-2012-RW-1. This isolate is part of the collection maintained at the College of Public Health, Medical, and Veterinary Sciences, James Cook University. This isolate originated from an adult L. serrata that was collected from Birthday Creek, a site in the Wet Tropics region of Queensland, Australia (18°58′54″ S, 146°10′02″ E), and died in captivity. The isolate had been cryo-archived after two passages in nutrient broth. We revived an aliquot of the isolate and cultured it in tryptone/gelatin hydrolysate/lactose (TGhL) broth in 25-cm 3 tissue culture flasks, passaging it twice before the experiment and maintaining cultures at 22 °C.
